Home health care services are an area of medical and non-medical services where patients may be treated and permitted to get better while keeping in their own home. It is typically far more cost-effective than hospitalization and far more convenient and comfortable for the individual. A large number of services are offered under the umbrella of home health care.

Occupational, physical, nursing, speech, etc. are some of common examples of health care offered at the patient's home. In fact since people seem to be in need of quite a variety of medical services everday, therefore there is an nearly countless list of home healthcare services available

Care givers who provide healthcare at a patient's home might move in with the patient or provide healthcare in shifts, based on the needs of the patient. For example 24/7 healthcare is require by patients who are paralyzed. Alternatively, merely a few hours of medical care or physical therapy might be required by a patient who has an injured leg. Therefore depending on the medical care that will be needed by the patient, home health care providers can be accordingly chosen by the guardians of the patients.
